meanings.definition: A Muslim legal expert who is empowered to give rulings on religious matters.
meanings.sent1: The muftis in our community provide guidance on religious issues.
meanings.sent2: I consulted with the muftis to understand the Islamic law better.
meanings.sent3: The muftis had a debate on the interpretation of the religious texts.
meanings.sent4: She sought the muftis' wisdom like a traveler seeking a guiding star.
meanings.sent5: The muftis' knowledge illuminated the path of understanding for many.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'mufti', referring to multiple Muslim legal experts.
meanings.sent1: During the conference, various muftis shared their insights on Islamic law.
meanings.sent2: The muftis gathered to discuss the recent changes in religious rulings.
meanings.sent3: It was a sight to see so many muftis in one place, each with their unique perspective.
meanings.sent4: The room buzzed with the collective wisdom of the muftis, like a beehive of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The muftis' presence added a layer of authority and expertise to the discussion.
